description: Triangle of numbers a(n,k) = number of "fountains" with n coins, k in the bottom row.
references: R. K. Guy, personal communication to _N. J. A. Sloane_.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..132, flattened
A. M. Odlyzko and H. S. Wilf, The editor's corner: n coins in a fountain, Amer. Math. Monthly, 95 (1988), 840-843.
formula: G.f.: 1/(1 - y*x / (1 - y*x^2 / (1 - y*x^3 / ( ... )))), from the Odlyzko/Wilf reference. [_Joerg Arndt_, Mar 25 2014]
mathematica: max = 17; f = 1/Fold[1 - y*x^#2/#1&, 1, Range[max] // Reverse]; s = Series[f, {x, 0, max+1}, {y, 0, max+1}]; a[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[s, {x, 0, n}, {y, 0, k}]; a[0, 0] = 1; Table[a[n, k], {n, 0, max}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jun 24 2015 *)
prog: (PARI)N=22; x='x+O('x^N);G(k)=if (k>N, 1, 1/(1-y*x^k*G(k+1)));V=Vec( G(1) );my( N=#V );rvec(V) = { V=Vec(V); my(n=#V); vector(n, j, V[n+1-j] ); }for(n=1, N, print( rvec( V[n]) ) ); \\ print triangle\\ _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 25 2014
